Key Match Events: Jos Buttler contributed 73 off 47 balls in a crucial match for England.
Alex Hales scored 52 off 40 balls in an opening stand worth 81 runs.
Mitchell Santner stumped Alex Hales after he advanced and missed the ball.
Liam Livingstone scored 20 off 14 balls, hitting Tim Southee for six and ramping Lockie Ferguson for four before being bowled by Ferguson.
Harry Brook, Ben Stokes, and Sam Curran were promoted above Dawid Malan in the batting order.
Buttler was dropped twice, once on eight and once on 40, before accelerating his scoring.
Buttler was run out in the penultimate over after a mix-up with Ben Stokes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England needed to win the match to realistically keep their semi-final hopes alive.
New Zealand had two wins and a washout in their three matches before this game.
